As an AI language model, I don't have personal experiences, but here are some general memory techniques and mnemonics that can be helpful for studying:

1. Visualization: Creating mental images of the information you need to remember can help make it stick. For example, if you need to remember a list of items, try picturing each item in your mind's eye or drawing a picture of each item.

2. Chunking: Breaking down information into smaller, more manageable chunks can make it easier to remember. For example, if you need to remember a long string of numbers, try grouping them into sets of two or three digits.

3. Acronyms: Using the first letter of each word in a sequence to create an acronym can be a helpful memory aid. For example, in order to remember the order of the planets in our solar system, some people use the acronym My Very Educated Mother Just Served Us Noodles (Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune).

4. Rhymes and mnemonics: Creating a memorable rhyme or mnemonic device can help you remember specific pieces of information. For example, to remember the order of the colors in a rainbow, some people use the phrase "Roy G. Biv" (red, orange, yellow, green, blue, indigo, violet).

5. Repetition and practice: Repeating information over and over can help it sink in. Practice recalling the information from memory regularly, and try testing yourself on it to reinforce your memory.
